intro: Eschscholzia austinae, commonly known as the Austina's poppy, is a rare and endemic species native to California. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features showy, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
